title: Failing fast at scale: Rapid prototyping at Intuit
description: Have an idea? Turn it into a prototype first.
author: Ryan Donovan
excerpt: Have an idea? Turn it into a prototype first.
text: January 8, 2025Have an idea? Turn it into a prototype first. On today’s episode, Ben and Ryan chat with Himanshu Sharma, Staff Software Engineer at Intuit, about their processes for rapid prototyping. Rapid prototyping has a deep history at Intuit, starting from their very first product design. They talk about how that process went from notes on a scratch pad at a kitchen table to a repeatable and reliable process baked into the culture of an organization the scale of Intuit.Episode notesTo learn more about technology or careers at Intuit, visit intuit.com/technology.To connect with Himanshu, find him on LinkedIn.Congrats to Populist badge winner, RobW, for their answer to git refusing to fetch into current branch.TRANSCRIPT
html:
January 8, 2025

Have an idea? Turn it into a prototype first.

On today’s episode, Ben and Ryan chat with Himanshu Sharma, Staff Software Engineer at Intuit, about their processes for rapid prototyping. Rapid prototyping has a deep history at Intuit, starting from their very first product design. They talk about how that process went from notes on a scratch pad at a kitchen table to a repeatable and reliable process baked into the culture of an organization the scale of Intuit.

Episode notes

To learn more about technology or careers at Intuit, visit intuit.com/technology.

To connect with Himanshu, find him on LinkedIn.

Congrats to Populist badge winner, RobW, for their answer to git refusing to fetch into current branch.

TRANSCRIPT
